model

Class SystemGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.SystemGenerator

  • public class SystemGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is responsible for handling the generation of the various system levels. Designed to provide a centralised location for the business logic and allow more transparent method calling.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SystemGenerator()
      Default constructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void checkElementaryServices()
      Creates the L1 decomposition for the input system.
      void generateL0()
      Responsible for creating the first and most basic level of the system with no decompositions.
      void generateL1()
      displays the L1 system view.
      private void recursiveInputAdd(SimpleService parent, SimpleService child, IOVariable out, java.util.ArrayList<IOVariable> checkedLocals)
      Runs through the list of connected IOVariables and connects all the inputs together, recursively running itself on local variables so all related local variables are associated to the same subservice.
      void uploadFile()
      Prompts the user for an input file and resets the generated level flags to allow the program to generate new levels based on the new input.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • SystemGenerator

        public SystemGenerator()
        Default constructor. No information is needed as this will only run methods without storing data

    • Method Detail

      • uploadFile

        public void uploadFile()
        Prompts the user for an input file and resets the generated level flags to allow the program to generate new levels based on the new input. Currently this only accepts XML files but it will later be extended to include other file types.

      • generateL0

        public void generateL0()
        Responsible for creating the first and most basic level of the system with no decompositions. If an input file hasn't been chosen, it runs the uploadFile method to prompt the user.

      • checkElementaryServices

        public void checkElementaryServices()
        Creates the L1 decomposition for the input system. If generateL0 hasn't been executed then it does so before continuing. The name is a slight misnomer and is named so by the previous team.

      • generateL1

        public void generateL1()
        displays the L1 system view. If checkElementaryServices hasn't been executed, then it does so before continuing.

      • recursiveInputAdd

        private void recursiveInputAdd(SimpleService parent,
                               SimpleService child,
                               IOVariable out,
                               java.util.ArrayList<IOVariable> checkedLocals)
        Runs through the list of connected IOVariables and connects all the inputs together, recursively running itself on local variables so all related local variables are associated to the same subservice.
        Parameters:
        parent - The parent service being decomposed
        child - the subservice being created
        out - The local variable that starts the recursion chain.
        checkedLocals - Reference to the list keeping track of local variables that have been checked to prevent looping recursive calls.
